name: ROGUE
quote: You live and operate in the margins, striking unseen and disappearing before anyone knows you were there.

coreTalent.name: EXPERTISE
coreTalent.description:
Choose a skillset below as your expertise:

Skullduggery: Take +1d at stealth, picking locks, lying, and sleight of hand.

Assassination: Take +1d at stealth, tracking people, opening strikes, and disguises.

Each session, you have a 3d Contingency resource pool, always planning ahead. You can roll the pool as bonus dice after any roll that falls within your expertise.

GROWTH: Every 2 levels, increase Contingency by 1d.

details.name: THIEVES GUILD [OPTIONAL]
details.description:
Many rogues learned their trade from a thieves' guild, criminal ring, or underground network. These are all one form of a guild or another, whether formal or not.

THIEVES GUILD: Choose 2 that describe your guild and 1 that really doesn't.

○ Like family○ Turf-obsessed○ Mystics○ Scoundrels
○ Elite training○ Heroes○ Outsiders○ In the open
○ Cultish○ Mercenaries○ Renegades○ Wardens

details.name: CRIMINAL HISTORY [OPTIONAL]
details.description:
Given their skillset, a rogue either learned their trade by way of crime or possess the skills to make an excellent criminal, for which there's no lack of opportunities. As you start your adventuring career, it's likely you have some lingering criminal history, a past that can come back to haunt you in quite fun, dramatic ways.

Create one or more past crimes by setting the crime (severity & nature), your reputation from it, and your own reaction about the crime.

THE CRIMEREPUTATION

REACTION: I did what I had to do—I was set up—It was a misunderstanding—I'd do it again in a heartbeat—I completely forgot I did that—I've made peace with it—Never again. Or write one!

pathTalent.name: ACCORDING TO PLAN
pathTalent.description: You gain 1 story per session and can spend story to flashback to utilizing subterfuge in a way that's immediately relevant, like swiping some keys, paying off a guard, or preparing an escape route. Make a montage roll, taking +1d for Expertise. The GM always takes suspense in place of an impact move.

pathTalent.name: ELDRITCH AFFINITY
pathTalent.description: You have spellcasting, as the Sorcery talent (pg. 72). You roll Presence to cast and choose 3 from magic paths and techniques that serve as touchstones. You can't cast potent spells, nor do you risk a wild surge. [PROHIBITED: SORCERER]

pathTalent.name: LURKER
pathTalent.description: On a perfect sneaking past or secretly observing sentient creatures, they: let a secret slip—give you a golden opportunity. If caught sneaking, you can push yourself to stay completely still and avoid detection, but must leave the area immediately after.

pathTalent.name: OPPORTUNIST
pathTalent.description: When someone nearby rolls defense, you take +1d on an immediate follow-up. On a critical by a nearby ally, you can push yourself to add another critical bonus.

pathTalent.name: POISONER
pathTalent.description: Each session, you have a 4d Poisons resource pool. You have access to the following poisons: hallucinations—knockout—memory loss—nausea—paralysis—truth serum. They each take a bit of time to work and are most effective if ingested.

pathTalent.name: TRAP SENSE
pathTalent.description: You always get a hint or reveal on vigilance against traps. When you avoid or disable a trap, take spark.

pathTalent.name: WEASEL
pathTalent.description: If caught in a lie or red-handed, you can push yourself to weasel your way out of the situation—for now. You get an exit, but they definitely realize what happened soon after.
